page.title: 13Whitminster Childrens Games.
page.content:
Continued from page 12.
The idea of British Bulldog is for two lines of people to run at each other and get past without anyone getting tagged by the person standing between the two lines. If anyone gets tagged then they become IT for the next round.
These games show a high level of ingenuity on the part of local school children but are noticeable for their lack of derivation from other modern means of entertainment such as the television. Children in this rural area still prefer to use their imagination rather than rely on external forms of fun.
